content: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><modsCollection rowCount="1"><mods><identifier type="pw">ofr20131149</identifier><identifier type="pwpk">70055859</identifier><identifier type="series">Open-File Report</identifier><identifier type="seriesNumber">2013-1149</identifier><identifier type="seriesCode">OFR</identifier><genre>USGS Numbered Series</genre><titleInfo><title>Geochemistry of soils from the San Rafael Valley, Santa Cruz County, Arizona</title></titleInfo><originInfo><dateOther>Wed, 20 Nov 2013 10:20 -0600</dateOther><dateIssued>2013</dateIssued><publisher>U.S. Geological Survey</publisher><placeTerm>Reston, VA</placeTerm></originInfo><name><namePart>Folger, Helen W.; Gray, Floyd</namePart><role>Author</role></name><abstract>This study was conducted to determine whether surficial geochemical methods can be used to identify subsurface mineraldeposits covered by alluvium derived from surrounding areas. The geochemical investigation focused on an anomalous geo-physical magnetic high located in the San Rafael Valley in Santa Cruz County, Arizona. The magnetic high, inferred to be asso-ciated with a buried granite intrusion, occurs beneath Quaternary alluvial and terrace deposits. Soil samples were collected at a depth of 10 to 30 centimeters below land surface along transects that traverse the inferred granite. The samples were analyzed by inductively coupled plasma-mass spectrometry and by the partial-leach Mobile Metal Ion\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd method. Principal component and factor analyses showed a strong correlation between the soils and source rocks hosting base-metal replacement deposits in the Harshaw and Patagonia Mining Districts. Factor analysis also indicated areas of high metal concentrations associated with the Meadow Valley Flat. Although no definitive geochemical signature was identified for the inferred granite, concentrations otungsten and iron in the surrounding area were slightly elevated.</abstract><physicalDescription><form>Report: vi, 30 p.; 5 Tables</form><form>U.S. Geological Survey</form><form>Reston, VA</form></physicalDescription><location><url note="INDEX PAGE">http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2013/1149</url><url note="COMPANION FILES">http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2013/1149/tables/Table2.xls</url><url note="COMPANION FILES">http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2013/1149/tables/Table3.xls</url><url note="THUMBNAIL">http://pubs.er.usgs.gov/thumbnails/ofr20131149.jpg</url><url note="COMPANION FILES">http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2013/1149/tables/Table4.xls</url><url note="COMPANION FILES">http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2013/1149/tables/Table1.xls</url><url note="COMPANION FILES">http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2013/1149/tables/Table5.xls</url><url note="DOCUMENT">http://pubs.usgs.gov/of/2013/1149/pdf/of2013-1149.pdf</url></location><note type="citation/reference">Geochemistry of soils from the San Rafael Valley, Santa Cruz County, Arizona; 2013; OFR; 2013-1149; Open-File Report; Folger, Helen W.; Gray, Floyd</note><languageTerm>English</languageTerm><relatedItem type="original"><titleInfo><title>Open-File Report</title></titleInfo></relatedItem></mods></modsCollection>
